meanings.definition: Perform (work or tasks) in a hasty or careless manner.
meanings.sent1: She was scamping through her homework, rushing to finish.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers were scamping the job, leading to mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The chef scamped the recipe, resulting in a burnt dish.
meanings.sent4: His scamping of the project left a trail of errors behind.
meanings.sent5: The student's scamping of the essay was evident in the lack of detail.

meanings.definition: Engage in petty or unscrupulous behavior.
meanings.sent1: He was caught scamping by taking office supplies for personal use.
meanings.sent2: The scampering thief was known for scamping in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was scamping around the house, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The scamping fox cunningly stole food from the farm.
meanings.sent5: The scamping squirrel hoarded nuts from other animals.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in petty or unscrupulous behavior.
meanings.sent1: Beware of the scamping who tries to deceive you.
meanings.sent2: The town gossip was known as the local scamping.
meanings.sent3: The little scamping always found a way to cause trouble.
meanings.sent4: The sly scamping was always up to no good.
meanings.sent5: The cunning scamping was caught red-handed stealing cookies.
